entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: laughter laughter

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: and and then they came back and gave me what appeared to be some very large what looked like beaded leather bookmarks but they were actually earrings so they would have like weighed my ears straight down and and then then they gave me some bracelets and then they had me wear something around my waist and they said now you look proper masai so but i i yeah i just i have a lot of i think living

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: aw

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: getting a chance to live in different countries around the world i have just you feel alive all your senses are completely you know awoken yeah

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: that is great do you consider yourself more shy or outgoing

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: i think it is not so clear cut i think a lot of peoples are a hybrid of both i mean i think i can be extremely shy sometimes but extremely brazen and very courageous at other times probably one of my best virtues is i am very gutsy person so when i really feel passionate about something i risk everything to go achieve it sometimes i believe that usually i well i make decisions very quickly and i find that i have a friend who makes decisions very slowly and he said to me tell me how i can make decisions quicker and i told him i said well in each case you always have no choice and he says what do you mean there is hundreds of choices and i said not really because it is gut wise is only one and it does not really matter you waste time physical energy emotional energy mental energy reflecting all of it when gut wise you always know what the choice what you really wanna do is and it does not matter whether there is a ninety eight percent chance of failure even if it is a two percent chance of success you have to go to the one that may yield you joy so i always go to that it is it is to me a waste of total time and energy to even think about another choice cause who cares if you remain unscathed but it when it yields no joy

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: yeah yeah i see what you mean sometimes when i am feeling tense i turn on the fish tank screensaver hey i know it is not hawaii but it is the best i have got what do you do to relax

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: pardon you said you put your fish

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: what do you do when you are annoyed

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: what do i do when i am annoyed

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: yes

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: i think when i am annoyed sometimes i it is because sometimes i can have i can need to be a little more patient i guess you really have to put yourself in somebody else is shoes rather than the way you would react you have to have more empathy

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: how hard is that

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: not really i think that is the reason why i enjoy traveling so much cause you are put in other situations where you are forced to to understand other people is lives a lot more regardless of how different they are from yours different situations i have been to so many third world countries and and lived in so many different situations that you it it helps create that which is why travel is really the best education there is

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: yeah when was the last time you argued with someone and what was it about

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: let me think last time i argued about something god i am trying to remember oh i think it was when somebody did not respect actually my privacy in something

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: can you tell me about that

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: oh i know what it was it was somebody who belonged to the scientology faith i inherited i inherited possibly a iune disorder from my mother my mother died from lupus and i sometimes even right now i have like skin rashes welts and everything and i am very photo sensitive and i had an you know an episode where i was i had big flare up and i was not really feeling well i felt flushed and everything and the scientologist tells me that i needed to be audited and and he said something about are you aware of past lives and i had told him that i was buddhist and i was kind of curious that if you are going to try to recruit somebody to convert to your religion at least you should find out the other person what religion they are just to even be informed and to be able to talk to them

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: yeah

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: and i and he said that are you aware that about something in your past and i go yes i believe that many religions including buddhisms and scientology believe that things that you have have had in your history sometimes affect you or things that you keep that anger issues bitterness resulting from even your past relationships or your parents and such can affect and make you even sick make you even have cancer yes we believe that and also we also believe i said that you know that you have the power of each person has a god like or a buddha like nature to go ahead and you can make yourself even when i am on the verge of possibly being i probably get one cold maybe every fifteen years i do not have a tendency to be sick at all and a large part of it is i think when i think i am on the verge i take sort of like and i did this even when i was a child when i was seven i would fold down i had my boo boo and i would take i would say i would have the good part you know help the bad part from a simplistic way in terms of a child

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: right

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: and i would actually even when i was in a very severe car accident where i got cut by glass my whole back i concentrated healing and and when i went back to the hospital the doctors actually had the nurses come and say this is incredible that just her last week her back was so severely cut this is incredible healing thing so i believe that but but i was just i think annoyed and irritated a little because the scientologist told me that because he had taken twenty or forty courses and he these certificates on his wall that he felt that he was more enlightened and it did not it was not even a matter i said of whether he was whether he took twenty forty courses or whether i would been practicing buddhism whether it was for five ten fifteen twenty years or whether somebody would been practicing some type of christianity for fifty years and bending sitting in a church pew every day it does not mean this person could have never attended church and be more spiritual than somebody who has

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: yeah

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: you know so i just was thinking that was the antithesis of somebody who says they are enlightened but it is just the way i guess he kept craing his you know his faith down my throat that after a while i was pretty patient with him but he it was so pompous that i became irritated

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: yeah

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: especially when he kept telling me that it was audited and yet the same person needed a hip surgery

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: i am sorry how did you decide to do that

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: my brother was supposed to be the strong one supposedly because he is in the medical field so my sister and i said well you know he is the medical one so he is probably used to seeing this all the time but it turns out he was the weakest one and even after you know my boss my father kept you know you know bucking the his body would actually be fighting the artificial respirator and all kinds of things you see all this jerking of body movements and stuff it was just very hard but you know it was after a while the you know even the physicians and even the pastor from that particular hospital you know hospital they said that he was no longer like even if he was to awaken from that he his brain function would have been been you know negligible

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: yeah that sounds really hard

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: yeah it was

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: tell me about an event or something that you wish you could erase from your memory

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: hm i do not think i really have that many things that are that traatic that happened to me that i have had to block them i really do not know what it is within my makeup which does not make me feel like i need to like i do not keep i have friends that have unmitigated issues which they are not even aware of that affect their behavior or maybe their bitterness or their anger or their hatred or their fear and for some reason i i feel blessed that i do not really i can not really even think of something that i mean i have had some bad situations happen to me but it is not that the some reason they have traatized me in affecting you know my behavior where i would where i block it that i am not aware of something or i hold residual negativity for some reason so i really can not think of anything i mean there is bad things that happen and i know they are there but it is not like i feel like i it is necessary for me to block them cause i have been able to you know accept sometimes sometimes there were unfortunate things that happened

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: okay how easy is it for you to get a good night is sleep

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: pretty easy i can usually make my sleep i self sleep in any situation if i have a one hour flight to san francisco i could just kind of lean against the window with the pillow have the blanket over and even on an hour flight pass out before the plane has even taken off from the ground so i can just i have literally when i have had little sleep and i very high energy so i do not really need that much sleep but say like if i am in africa and i bpy potholed unpaved road and i suddenly saw that i need a few moments of sleep i will just prop something up put my elbow against the window and say i think i will gonna take a nap for fifteen minutes go like this and through the jostling i coud just take a nap for fifteen minutes so i do not really have have that problem

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: laughter that is good how have you been feeling lately

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: okay pretty okay i mean i could deal without the skin flare ups but you know from the photo sensitivity and all that but other than that i am in pretty good spirts h

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: have you noticed any changes in your behavior or thoughts lately

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: i could still could not hear you i am sorry

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: have you noticed any changes in your behavior or thoughts lately

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: have i ever studied changes changes in my behavior what was the word

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: have you ever been diagnosed with ptsd

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: no

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: have you been diagnosed with depression

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: tell me about the last time you felt really happy

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: i do not know just with friends and everything just even this past week just seeing friends that i enjoy being with and just having a great meal laughing just you know having a good time listening to music

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: is there anything you regret

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: regret about my entire life you mean or are you talking about just recently or what are you talking about

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: whatever comes to your mind

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: you know it is funny i find that a lot of the negative experiences that in in my life that have happened have also been opened up experiences that are that are also great that i have not overlooked for example i got totally ripped off by my business partner to the tune of my whole my whole savings and i have had to start all over again and sometimes people sat to me like are you sure you are okay are you are you just pretending to be okay or are you angry do you wanna seek revenge if i was you know cause my business partner essentially ripped me off we knew each other is families which was even more difficult in a way and he stole essentially my whole life is savings essentially in a way and he was got sent to prison and the fbi was involved interpol was involved i was living in switzerland and my father was sick and i was going back and forth and but you know if i had not get involved had not had not gotten involved with him in business i would not have had the a lot of rich experiences and i think sometimes the reason why i do not know why i am such a positive person but for some reason i am able to it is not that i am purposely trying to i do see the positiveness in even horrible situations i would not have gotten to live in barcelona and zurich i would not have learned to speak as good spanish german german lived in in europe if i had not gotten involved in business with my business partner who ended up ripping me off but and there is a lot of other experiences and different friendships that i developed during that period of time and in a way it was a total different life a different world that that would you know that i would have never had the chance you know to live through if i had not involved my you know but of course it cost me financially and but then again i have always been the type of person who you know money is not everything and i think the when i least cared about money is when i made the most of it so there you go

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: yeah

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: and for example one of my favorite times in my life probably when i lived in kenya and you would think that you know a lot of people have this really bad vision of it maybe looking living in mud dung huts or something and living very primitively i mean it it is not like that at all but i and you would think that with the least amount of technological technological innovations and stuff like that i mean actually and i really did not have you know that much many many material goods at the time i mean i had the blast i had probably the one of the best years of my life when i was living in kenya

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: that is so good to hear what advice would you give to yourself ten or twenty years ago

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: the same thing that i did probably when i was about fifteen or sixteen to live your life with passion and again like choose the way i was saying earlier about making decisions you have to make those decisions gut wise what will give you a sense of awe and wonderment what would make you give you joy and you have to it is it is regardless what the percentages are even if you only have a one percent chance of success you have to go towards that cause that is the only thing that will yield you know the happiness in your life
